@WendellWard3 2/2 How you live in your home will also affect the radon level, which is why it is important to test your home while you are living in it. If home builders tested for radon before occupancy, the results may not be accurate.

@WendellWard3 1/2 Testing your home for radon involves doing a 3-month test during the fall/winter months. This is the time of year when windows and doors are closed and when the radon level in your home will be the highest.
